alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:52PM EST until February 19 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The Cumberland River at Barbourville, affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Flooding threatens homes and businesses in unprotected areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 32.3 feet and falling. - The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EST Saturday was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage after midnight tonight and continue falling. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued by midnight tonight.
